required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Four File Folders Program Cognitive Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Time Management for All Ages With Basic Accounting Cognitive Approach in Healing

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The Four File Folders System of time management skills with basic accounting is a Neo Freudian cognitive approach with Erik Erikson's theory of psychosocial stages of human conditioning. The support and budget analysis folders process is formulated through B.F. Skinner's social interaction of law of effect through experience building permanent, but adjustable behavior patterns of time efforts and money building equity mind-set for all ages. A humanistic approach structured learned behavior in spending through observation, instruction and experience.

detailed_description.textblock:
Aim 1: Define how each stage (by age groups) in learned behavior (human conditioning) of a family unit how time management affects behavior in backup analogy, functionality, sustainability and recovery processes of managing a home and money.
Aim 2: Structure time frame in three parts of identifying and changing the problem that is short-term, managing crisis through operant awareness and assisting clients acknowledging disorders resulting from long term exposure within home and community.
Aim 3: Determine the statistical analysis and the effectiveness of the program will be measured in thirteen categories consisting of community components of family understanding the behavioral/social interaction of support and knowledge of a family unit or individual.
Significance: Importance of the program is to submit accurate data analysis to government sources for the reduction of poverty in the nation and by proving the theory of the program as a productive measurement in determining factors to improve education and healing needs of individuals.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.description: Reduction of distressing symptoms, frustration, insecurity, jealousy, blaming, suicidal, demanding of others, destructive, retaliatory, isolation, unsettled, nervous, impatient

secondary_outcome.description: Impairment of functioning: excessive co-dependence, loss of control (non-management), confusion (unknown details), lack of comprehension (unaware of rules and guidelines society norms). Risk of suffering: change in home environment-death, illness, pain, disability or loss of freedom (health conditions), dismay, depression, disorder, anxiety, lost, disillusion (crime related factors)

other_outcome.description: Deviant Behavior: individual versus society, type of factors of survival leading to criminal behavior or developing abusive or negligent relationships, intervention of domestic violence family setting/individual setting

Title: Change from initial crisis of three office visits with assessments, six months follow up efficacy report based upon identifiers and conclude with one year follow up results of permanent changes within the family unit. Inclusion Report Standard Measures mandate research results of Outline consists of Identifying the Problem and Change, Mental Health Disorders effecting the family unit and Managing Crisis in categories based upon age groups of family units. Final results are measured in eight categories of managed skills achieved for sustainability.

Quarterly Report Analysis is website research statistics. The webpages: Children's Corner for children/teens (ages 6 -18), Wisdom of Spending (ages 18-72). First results of Children's Corner: 21,000 viewers -Interaction with children in public like the page as it assist with comprehension skills of their parents spending habits and emotions. Children identify the pictures with similar attributes of their own feelings. Children discuss with me the problems of folders and understand why the folders must sync. Children comprehend folders and sync observing parents check balances by cell phone, checkbook or cash. Managing crisis of money shortage is an area the children feel their parents should utilize the folders to be aware of monetary position before spending money easing distress of their emotions. First results of Wisdom of Spending: 10,000 viewers. Adults prefer to select category of the four file folders that pertain to a scenario they are experiencing at the moment.

arm_group.description: The Four File Folders Program: Modification of Behavior-intervention Re-organization/Managed Skills program six months follow up update inclusion report stats Managed Skills with Complete Function-intervention with observation six months follow up update for care Crime Prevention-intervention results six months update with affiliated services of the client with commendations for care

intervention.description: Folders of Awareness, Knowledge, Confidence and Patience
Folders are Awareness, Support, Budget and Knowledge

Behavioral/Social Interaction Theory: Individuals learn from observation, interaction and education with family providing strong program value systems in personal management for individuals and family. The program in three stages of pre-management, reorganization and managed skills is a humanistic approach in development according to age learning time management skills with basic accounting knowledge in a structured mind-set for a healthier way of living reducing the need for welfare assistance.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Clinical diagnosis of economic factors effecting individuals/family units health and maintenance of lifestyles
- managing crisis managing health disorders related modification of behavior
Exclusion Criteria:
- medication disbursements diagnosis of internal medicine

overall_official.affiliation: University of New Mexico Behavioral Health Education Department
